	id 303C627465; Tue, 21 Apr 2015 08:22:22 -0700 (PDT)

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Good afternoon Lebanon Residents,

Folks were unable to connect to the survey via yesterday's post, as there w=
as an error in the link.  Below is the letter about the survey and the link=
 that should work.  Please let me know if you have trouble accessing the su=
rvey.

ALL Together, formerly the Upper Valley Substance Misuse Prevention Partner=
ship is a regional coalition that takes action to reduce the impact of alco=
hol and drug misuse in support of the development of healthy, safe, and res=
ilient youth.

The Lebanon community has been identified as an Upper Valley community to b=
e a part of the substance misuse conversation and prevention efforts in our=
 region.

ALL Together wants to know what you (as Lebanon Residents) see and how you =
feel about substance use in your community. Participation in this survey wi=
ll help us do this and will inform our work going forward.

Click on the link for the survey: https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/2015UpperV=
alleyCommunitySurvey

Please answer as honestly as possible. Your answers are confidential.  This=
 survey will take approximately 15 minutes to complete.  The survey will be=
 open until June 30, 2015.

You only need to complete this survey once. Thank you in advance for taking=
 the time to complete this survey and for being part of the substance misus=
e prevention conversation!

Respectfully,

Angie M. Leduc

Drug Free Communities Partnership Coordinator
All Together, the Upper Valley Substance Misuse Prevention Partnership
Community Health Improvement
Dartmouth-Hitchcock Medical Center
Phone: (603) 653-6863
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/TwinStateSafeMeds
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/UVAllTogether

All Together is a coalition that takes action to reduce the impact of alcoh=
ol and drug misuse in support of the development of healthy, safe, and resi=
lient youth.

AT is part of the Upper Valley Public Health Network and is  supported by D=
rug Free Communities, the NH Bureau of Drug and Alcohol Services and the Ne=
w Hampshire Charitable Foundation.  Additional resources are provided by Da=
rtmouth-Hitchcock.

TWIN STATE SAFE MEDS is a multi-organization collaboration to support the d=
evelopment of healthy, safe, and resilient communities that take action to =
reduce the impact of alcohol and drug misuse.



IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING THIS ELECTRONIC MESSAGE:

This message is intended for the use of the person to whom it is addressed =
and may contain information that is privileged, confidential, and protected=
 from disclosure under applicable law. If you are not the intended recipien=
t, your use of this message for any purpose is strictly prohibited. If you =
have received this communication in error, please delete the message and no=
tify the sender so that we may correct our records.
---------------------------
To POST a message to this list, email your message to lebanon@lists.valley.=
net=20=20

When posting, keep it specific to Lebanon. Residents are encouraged to subs=
cribe and post; non-residents may subscribe, but are asked not to post.=20

All Upper Valley-wide posts should be sent ONLY to uppervalley@lists.valley=
.net

Please sign your posts.  Limit commercial postings to once a month.  Keep y=
our tone civil and respectful.

To be REMOVED from this list, send a blank message to lebanon-unsubscribe@l=
ists.valley.net   More details including Archives at http://lists.valley.ne=
t/lists/info/lebanon

This discussion list is provided at no cost by Vital Communities. To learn =
more, go to www.vitalcommunities.org











--_000_8F117A49E1FC2F439390829074E674CA14ECC545DH206DHMCMaster_

<div style=3D"background: transparent; border: none; clear: both; display: =
block; float: none; position: static">---------------------------<br/>To PO=
ST a message to this list, email your message to <a href=3D"mailto:lebanon@=
lists.valley.net">lebanon@lists.valley.net</a>  <br/><br/>When posting, kee=
p it specific to Lebanon. Residents are encouraged to subscribe and post; n=
on-residents may subscribe, but are asked not to post. <br/><br/>All Upper =
Valley-wide posts should be sent ONLY to <a href=3D"mailto:uppervalley@list=
s.valley.net">uppervalley@lists.valley.net</a><br/><br/>Please sign your po=
sts.  Limit commercial postings to once a month.  Keep your tone civil and =
respectful.<br/><br/>To be REMOVED from this list, send a blank message to =
<a href=3D"mailto:lebanon-unsubscribe@lists.valley.net">lebanon-unsubscribe=
@lists.valley.net</a>   More details including Archives at <a href=3D"http:=
//lists.valley.net/lists/info/lebanon">http://lists.valley.net/lists/info/l=
ebanon</a><br/><br/>This discussion list is provided at no cost by Vital Co=
mmunities. To learn more, go to www.vitalcommunities.org<br/><br/><br/><br/=
